titleStmt.title: John W. Finnell, Receipt to Louisville & Nashville Railroad Company
CWG13730

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 10; 1863 Office Expenses - Telegraph, Stationary - Transportation - Ordinance Stores; Bundle 5

body.p:
NO. 22.
The United States, State of Ky

To LOUISVILLE & NASHVILLE RAILROAD COMPANY, Dr
1862 For Transportation as follows Viz Mileage Total Mileage Rate Amount
December Lieut H. Tucker From Louisville to Lebanon Ky 67. 67.
✓
" Lieut Henry Tucker " " " Bacon Creek " 657 657
✓
" Wm Robinson " " " South Union " 1285 1285
✓
" Lieut Tucker " Lebanon " Louisville " 67. 67.
✓
" Sergt. Smith &. 2 Men " Rowletts Station to Bowling Green " 381 1143
✓
" 17 Men From Russellville to Bowling Green " 298 5066
✓
" 2 " " Gallatin Tenn " Horse Cave " 78 156
✓
11051 c 2¢ $22 10
add 3 per ¢ Port. Tax, as authorized by Q. M. Genl in Circular Dated Nov 14th 1862.
66
$22 76

Approved By order of the Governor
Jno. W Finnell
Adjt Genl Ky Vols
I certify, that the above account is correct and just; that the services were rendered as stated; and that they were necessary for the Public Service.
Received at Frankfort Ky the 18 of April 1863, of Jno W. Finnell Adj General Ky Volunteers Quartermaster U.S. Army the sum of Twenty two Dollars, and seventy six cents, in full of the above account.

NO. 22.
No. 160 Abstract B P Qr. 1862.
Lou & Nash R R co
Dollars 22 76/100
Paid April 18th 1863
